review_title: Great colleagues; poor administration and management
pros: extremely kind and helpful support staff; nearly everyone is friendly; offices close at noon or 1 on Fridays; students are awesome
cons: not enough staff for the amount of work; low pay; extremely underappreciated by upper administration; treated like a cog in the wheel and not a valued employee; expected to shoulder the burden of admin's poor financial decisions (for a place that charges $35,000/year tuition, you'd think they could pay their employees what they're worth)

pros: Good working hours, helps with your own academics as well
cons: nothing much to say about the cons

pros: Good community Welcoming Open to suggestions
cons: Slow at higher response Slow at pay

pros: Relaxed environment and family friendly.
cons: Pay is not align with market value.

job_title: Hvacr Service Technician in Riverside, CA
pros: People are friendly and nice environment. Employees appreciated and respected. Flexible schedule when needed.
cons: Low pay and not much opportunity for advancement. Understaffed.

job_title: Help Desk Assistant in Riverside, CA
pros: When there are no students/faculty in need of assistance, you are free to study or do personal work.
cons: A lot of time sitting. Overall, you get to help a lot of people.

pros: Good benefits and kind community
cons: They don’t value good, hard working employees so the good ones always leave for better jobs and then they don’t replace them so it leaves everyone overworked and under paid.

pros: They work with your schedule

review_title: I was a student custodial worker while attending La Sierra University.
pros: This worked well for my study schedule. I could put in all my hours before classes each day.
cons: This was not in my field of interest; however, it is something I am excellent at.

review_title: Could be better could be worse
pros: Community, work with your schedule, get free/discounted classes while you work there.
cons: You get paid $16 /hr in California where a 1 bedroom apartment is $1500...

pros: It can be a positive environment, most of the staff are friendly, and the benefits are decent.
cons: Pay for staff is far below average when compared to other universities (though not for administration from the look of it), and it implements a 36-hour work week. This works out nicely for salaried employees, but for hourly employees, a 36-hour work week means not getting the extra 16 hours on their paychecks compared to a traditional 40-hour work week. There is often little to no room to grow, and getting a job here is often seen as a stepping stone (i.e. getting experience here to then leave and get a "real job") to something better.

pros: A beautiful campus and a friendly community are the major benefits of La Sierra University.  It's location in Riverside is also a plus, putting you within easy reach of the ocean, mountains and desert.
cons: Pay is low, because you are working for a church institution, so your low salary is seen as service to God.  University is mired in controversy over the teaching of evolution as fact!  Recent high-profile resignations are the latest sign that La Sierra may not be around ( as it currently exists) for much longer.

review_title: A good place if you don't care about career advancement.
pros: Great work-life balance, great benefits, nice people, committed staff, great opportunities to learn basic to intermediate skills. School Scheduling, easy to get time off for personal or sick days.
cons: Low wages.  Most staff make under 40-50k while top admin makes between 100-200k.  No room for advancement or a desire to develop talent for top positions.  If you want in to top positions, leave and then come back.

pros: Working on campus while attending college. Fair pay for work done. Early job experience gained. Easy to schedule hours around classes.
cons: High competition for jobs. Some jobs are restricted by your major. Easy to lose job if performance isn't good enough.

job_title: IT Tech Support in Riverside, CA
pros: easy job. and they basically let me work unsupervised once I proved I was competent.
cons:
Sexual harrasment from superiors. (you just learn to ignore it)

Blame always placed on the lower employees even when they're undeniably not at fault.

pros: Good work environment that is Christian yet open to all religious preferences. Flexible hours and relaxed company culture. Good benefits.
cons: No vertical growth opportunities and most employees are not passionate about doing their best. Below average pay.

pros: A christian based institution with a positive environment. The university is always aggressively evolving, improving and changing to meet and exceed the needs of students, parents and visitors.
cons: Compensation package (for staff) is far below average of the national fair market value.

pros: Beautiful campus, peaceful atmosphere, ability to be open about your spirituality, love the students.
cons: Stuck in the "olden days", poor on-boarding of new employees, inconsistent messages from management regarding support of campus programs.

pros:
